newsitem.title: USA: Hewlett-Packard unveils new Vectra computer.
newsitem.headline: Hewlett-Packard unveils new Vectra computer.

text.p: Hewlett-Packard Co on Monday unveiled its Vectra XW personal computer workstation aimed at mechanical engineers and animation artists who design products in three dimensions.
The product is part of Hewlett-Packard's previously announced strategy to offer technical-computing customers a choice of computer platforms.

"We are excited about HP's bringing the high-performance, industrial-strength reliability and security of Windows NT Workstation 4.0 to its new line of HP Vectra XW personal workstations," said Jonathan Roberts, director of desktop marketing at Microsoft.
The HP Vectra XW personal workstation will be sold through HP's established network of value-added resellers, with demand to be generated by HP commercial and enterprise sales forces.
